''Duke's Comeback Season Ends Short of the Title'' (May 29) gave short shrift to the great accomplishment of the Johns Hopkins men's lacrosse team. The Blue Jays established a record by winning their ninth N.C.A.A. tournament championship.
Johns Hopkins should be duly recognized even while noting the emotional aspect of the runner-up team.
Peter D. Byeff, M.D. Southington, Conn.

The Division I men's lacrosse championship game should have been reported as a Johns Hopkins victory first, a Duke loss second. Hopkins, by design, jumped out to the early lead, anticipating Duke's inevitable run. When Duke went on that run, Hopkins kept cool and played its game.
The Johns Hopkins team came to play lacrosse, and its efforts were rewarded. End of story.
